meanings.definition: The act of not consuming or using something.
meanings.sent1: Nonconsumption can help save money by avoiding unnecessary purchases.
meanings.sent2: In times of economic downturn, nonconsumption tends to increase.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the title of 'Master of Nonconsumption' was fierce at the frugal living convention.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a shrine to nonconsumption, with barely a hint of any unnecessary items.
meanings.sent5: The concept of nonconsumption is like a shield against the temptations of consumerism.

meanings.definition: The state of not consuming goods or services.
meanings.sent1: Nonconsumption of luxury items is a common practice among minimalists.
meanings.sent2: During the pandemic, nonconsumption of non-essential goods became more prevalent.
meanings.sent3: The town's annual 'Festival of Nonconsumption' featured games and activities centered around sustainable living.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of consumerism, his lifestyle stood out as a beacon of nonconsumption.
meanings.sent5: Her commitment to nonconsumption was unwavering, even in the face of societal pressure to buy more.
